remarks: In a total order, the finite intersections of the open rays generates the set of open intervals, but no more - these four collections form a subbasis for the order topology.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)
statement:
ordtval.1 $e |- X = dom R $.
ordtval.2 $e |- A = ran ( x e. X |-> { y e. X | -. y R x } ) $.
ordtval.3 $e |- B = ran ( x e. X |-> { y e. X | -. x R y } ) $.
ordtval.4 $e |- C = ran ( a e. X , b e. X |-> { y e. X | ( -. y R a /\ -. b R y ) } ) $.
ordtbas $p |- ( R e. TosetRel -> ( fi ` ( { X } u. ( A u. B ) ) ) = ( ( { X } u. ( A u. B ) ) u. C ) ) $.
$d A a b $.
$d B a b $.
$d R a b x y $.
$d X a b x y $.
